result.execSummary:
The defendant Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**Restitution set at $0 (zero).**

Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Court does not oppose sentence being served in LaCrosse.

**08-03-15/Order granting 3 additional days of sentence credit for a total of 25 days**

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: -Granting Request For Additional Sentence Credit; received, filed and signed by the Court on August 3, 2015; Copies distributed to parties and file back to closing to amend JOC.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. mag
Defendant's request for additional sentence credit.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 22 (twenty-two) days time served. Court does not opposes sentence being served in Lacrosse. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by July 27, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Court WAIVED waivable costs. 
Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).


Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich in court with attorney Anne Jaspers on behalf of attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Speedway Gas Station - W. Burnham St.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-Trial Conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 a.m.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
